description: Should you merge your finances with your significant other? Keep them separate? Or something in between? NPR's Life Kit breaks down different ways to handle finances with your partner.
title: Life Kit: Tips for managing joint bank accounts

description: NPR's Adrian Florido speaks with retired astronaut Terry Virts about what the Boeing Starliner astronauts might going through being in space longer than they thought they would be.
title: Amid the Starliner delay, a former astronaut discusses being stuck in space

description: NPR's Domenico Montanaro speaks with attorney and former DOJ official Harry Litman about how the Supreme Court's immunity ruling could affect the pending cases facing former President Trump.
title: Supreme Court immunity ruling likely to affect Trump's cases, says former DOJ official

description: Police officers discovered seven people shot at a home in Florence, Ky., shortly before 3 a.m. Saturday. The suspected shooter  later died.
title: 5 people are dead and 3 others wounded after a shooting in northern Kentucky

description: The Kansas Supreme Court ruled against two anti-abortion laws, suggesting other restrictions could fall. The state has received numerous patients from states with tighter laws.
title: Kansas Supreme Court rules against strict abortion laws amidst an influx of patients

description: President Biden gave an exclusive interview to ABC News Friday and tried to calm voters concerned about whether he should run for another term. We'll discuss how he did.
title: Week in politics: Biden tries to do debate damage control with ABC interview

description: NPR's Scott Simon and ESPN's Michele Steele discuss the US men's soccer team's flameout at Copa America and a criminal probe into doping.
title: Saturday Sports: Copa America and the U.S. men's soccer team, criminal probe into doping

description: Seniors choosing Medicare Advantage plans for the first time often don't realize they might get locked out of traditional Medicare for good. But changing this problem must be done state by state.
title: California tried to fix a major Medicare loophole for seniors

description: Kellen Matthews-Thompson says in early addiction recovery, you need to “change people, places and things." His Recovery Run Club is designed to help people when they are at their most vulnerable.
title: In Philadelphia, a run club helps those recovering from addiction find purpose

description: Voters in France cast ballots Sunday in a runoff election between a far-right party and a coalition of moderate and centrist parties.
title: Voters in France will cast their ballots in a run-off election

description: NPR's Scott Simon asks historian and Atlantic magazine writer Anne Applebaum how different right-wing movements are in Europe and in the U.S.
title: Right wing movements are growing in Europe. How do they differ from those in the U.S.?

description: NPR's Scott Simon talks with Robert Shrimsley of the Financial Times about the election in the UK, when the incumbent Conservative Party lost badly.
title: U.K.'s Conservative Party suffered its worst-ever defeat. What went wrong?

description: As part of our StoryCorps Military Voices Initiative, we hear from two veterans who volunteer with disaster relief operations, Michael Davidson and Windy Barton.
title: Veterans remember their time in disaster relief operations

description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Rabbi Tamar Manasseh about a recent shooting right outside a community center she set up on Chicago's South Side, and her fear for the safety of the children who use it.
title: A Chicago rabbi was a committed advocate for gun safety. A recent attack changed that

description: In an effort to quell calls for him to quit the race, Biden sat for a network TV interview with ABC’s George Stephanopoulos Friday night. Did it work?
title: 6 takeaways from Biden's high-stakes interview

description: A volunteer curator in Philadelphia puts on art exhibits to raise awareness of lives lost to gun violence.
title: These bigger-than-life portraits turn gun death statistics into indelible stories

description: As South Korea's population shrinks, foreign migrant workers are joining the country's workforce. But a recent deadly fire exposed the risks some of them are facing.
title: A deadly fire exposes the lack of protection for migrant workers in South Korea

description: Reformist candidate Masoud Pezeshkian beat hard-liner Saeed Jalili in the runoff election to replace the late president who was killed in a helicopter crash in May.
title: Reformist Pezeshkian wins in Iran's presidential runoff

description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Royal Ramey, the co-founder and CEO of the Forestry and Fire Recruitment Program, about the pathway for formerly incarcerated firefighters to build careers in the field.
title: Incarcerated people who helped fight wildfires struggle to build a career post-prison
